Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 10:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: We are carrying out these works to connect new properties onto the underground electricity network on Estcourt Road. This work is following on from a customers request and due to the type of underground electricity cables we need to make the connection to, engineers will need to temporarily switch off your power, along with 15 neighbouring properties to ensure they can carry out this work safely. These works will improve the reliability of the electricity and will also ensure our network can uphold the amount of electricity in the area. To reassure you we are adhering to the latest government guidelines to keep all our customers and colleagues safe.
